experience.responsibilities: I worked in a bakery, waking up early to decorate donuts and bake bread, amongst other goods.
We've completed two independent tours across 11 states. I design, develop, and maintain our website; built with Eleventy and hosted on Netlify via git.
I was responsible for cataloging our inventory of content and creative works to help the team quickly find assets. Additionally, I researched relevant topics for writing and publishing blogs.

I managed the email channel to drive conversions and engagement. As such, I designed and built custom mobile-responsive promotional and transactional templates, implemented automated workflows, list management, and improved our HubSpot deliverability score from a 1 to a 67 (avg. score = 50), greatly improving effectiveness of the channel. I also headed the SEO, which included maintaining our keyword database and Moz Pro reporting, identifying opportunities for dietary-specific landing pages that greatly increased organic performance.

I conduct end-to-end testing for active and returning products and promotions, while also ensuring best practices in performance and accessibility. I monitor the health of our owned domains, paying particular attention to blacklisting reports. My work extends to communication with affiliate marketers to ensure compliance of our advertising guidelines and CAN-SPAM. I stay up to date on the latest developments in the front end to help the team be prepared for potential changes or optimization opportunities.
This is a new position and I will be working to design and develop a WordPress website for the school's arts department.

interests.blurb: When I'm not writing code, I'm probably writing music, or learning about literally anything new.

links.name: Front Royal
links.desc: A somewhat punk band with a splash of indie.
